skill.name: creating-skills
skill.description:
Creates new Claude Code skills following best practices. Guides through skill structure,
naming, descriptions, and progressive disclosure. Use when user wants to create a skill,
build a skill, make a new capability, or asks about skill best practices.

naming, des...
skill.author: BrendanShields

security_audit.summary: Pure documentation skill containing templates and validation guidelines. No network access, no code execution beyond local file reads, no credential access. The included validate.sh script only reads skill files for compliance checking.

content.value_statement: Creating Claude Code skills from scratch can be confusing without guidance. This skill provides step-by-step instructions, validated templates, and best practices so anyone can build well-structured skills that follow established patterns.
actual_capabilities: Guide users through skill creation workflow with step-by-step instructions
Provide basic and advanced skill templates for different complexity levels
Validate skill structure against established best practices
Enforce naming conventions (gerund format, lowercase, length limits)
Check descriptions for proper activation triggers and third-person voice
Review existing skills against anti-patterns and suggest improvements
limitations: Does not generate full skill code or automation scripts
Does not install or configure skills in user environments
Does not interact with external APIs or services
Does not test skills in actual Claude Code sessions

use_cases.title: Build your first skill
use_cases.description: New users learn the skill structure, naming rules, and workflow to create their first Claude Code skill.

use_cases.title: Standardize team skills
use_cases.description: Teams use templates and validation to ensure all skills follow consistent patterns and quality standards.

use_cases.title: Audit existing skills
use_cases.description: Reviewers check published skills against the reference guide and identify anti-patterns or improvements.

prompt_templates.title: Create basic skill
prompt_templates.scenario: New user wants to build a simple skill
prompt_templates.prompt: I want to create a skill that formats markdown files. Help me create it using the basic template.

prompt_templates.title: Build advanced skill
prompt_templates.prompt: I need to create a skill for database management with multiple workflows. Walk me through the advanced template.

prompt_templates.title: Validate skill
prompt_templates.prompt: Review my existing skill at ~/.claude/skills/my-skill and validate it against the best practices checklist.

prompt_templates.title: Fix skill issues
prompt_templates.prompt: My skill has validation errors. Check SKILL.md for naming issues, description problems, and line count limits.

output_examples.input: Create a skill that validates JSON files
output: Purpose: Validate JSON files against schemas
Trigger words: JSON validation, schema checking, data structure verification
Using basic template (simple workflow, under 200 lines)

best_practices: Use gerund format for skill names (verb-ing-noun) like 'processing-pdfs' or 'analyzing-data'
Keep SKILL.md under 300 lines and move detailed content to reference files
Write descriptions in third person with clear trigger words that activate the skill
anti_patterns: Using first-person descriptions like 'I help you' instead of third-person active voice
Including Windows-style paths (backslashes) instead of Unix-style (forward slashes)
Adding time-sensitive information like dates or version numbers that become outdated

faq.question: What tools support skill creation?
faq.answer: Claude, Codex, and Claude Code all support skills. Skills are compatible across the Anthropic AI product family.

faq.question: What is the maximum skill name length?
faq.answer: Skill names must be 64 characters or less, using lowercase letters, numbers, and hyphens only.

faq.question: Can I use this skill with existing skills?
faq.answer: Yes, this skill helps create and review new skills. It does not modify or conflict with existing installed skills.

faq.question: What data does this skill access?
faq.answer: This skill only reads documentation files. It does not access user data, credentials, or make network requests.

faq.question: Why does my validation fail?
faq.answer: Common issues: missing frontmatter, non-gerund name format, description uses first person, or SKILL.md exceeds 500 lines.

faq.question: How is this different from writing code directly?
faq.answer: Skills provide documentation-based guidance that enhances Claude's behavior. They are not executable code but structured instructions.
